redactedMessages.subject: Re: System improvements / ideas
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

Can I just manage expectations and underline some parts from: [REDACTED NAME] email.

¬†

So ‚Äì as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a ‚ÄúVALUE‚Äù and we compare that against all the developments within the business.

¬†

You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these ‚Äì eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.

¬†

Example - ¬†I have a live example of a request I have rejected ‚Äì Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. I have done a quick calculation, and that development would assist us in less than .5% of all bookings. The actual dev would take 3-4 days. We don‚Äôt have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200 ‚Äì we have to: [REDACTED NAME] manually somehow. The developments we MUST focus on are the ones to: [REDACTED NAME] team blockers, and that‚Äôs what I will focus on.

¬†

This is YOUR team, managing YOUR pipeline in terms of priority. I am here to: [REDACTED NAME] process.

¬†

I don‚Äôt want this appear to: [REDACTED NAME], you team need to: [REDACTED NAME] do anything and everything to help‚Ä¶.but you guys must help yourselves in terms of organising the priority. So from: [REDACTED NAME] below ‚Äì what are your TOP 3 in terms of delivering the highest value, and why ?

¬†

Can you chase up all the Team leaders for their recommendations and lets see and come up multiple times üòâ

¬†

BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

¬†

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Wednesday, 22 May 2024 at 12:11
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: System improvements / ideas

Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

¬†

Implementing several of these suggestions would undoubtedly benefit both the team and other departments.

¬†

¬†

ENS builder (how and when can we make it fully automated?).

ENS builder ‚Äì Stena Line forms to: [REDACTED NAME] and validated. The team shouldn‚Äôt be handling it.

PPB ‚Äì Port passes to: [REDACTED NAME] and validated by operators' systems. (validation part is missing).

Information page reviewed, relevant information + booking process where applicable. I‚Äôm already in discussion with John, he is pushing Zone leads for accurate information. To: [REDACTED NAME] the learning process we have requested a box to: [REDACTED NAME] ‚ÄúHow to book‚Äù. Dev request was submitted last week.

F2 / F3 needs to: [REDACTED NAME] interactive, with some sort of reminders / warnings (pop-ups?)

F2 ‚Äì When booking an abnormal load, the price should disappear after selecting "abnormal."

F2 ‚Äì When repeating the job, weight, width, and height should automatically change to standard.

Zone leads to: [REDACTED NAME] accounts where possible + clear info in information tab (Virtu Ferries and smaller ones).

Additional EDIs where possible (Tallink ‚Äì all bookings support).

Operators‚Äô emails ‚Äì Adding round-trip booking requests (Condor Ferries and IOM).

Amendments + Cancellation for EDI bookings to: [REDACTED NAME] (Web + App)

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

Regards,

E:¬†[REDACTED EMAIL]

T:¬†[REDACTED PHONE]

W:¬†freightlink.co.uk

A:¬†[REDACTED ADDRESS]





[REDACTED NAME]

Head of CS

redactedMessages.body:

¬†

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Wednesday, 15 November 2023 at 09:37
To: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: RE: CSV export from F2

Hi John

¬†

Apologies for the delayed response on this, we have not forgotten, and this has been discussed within the digital team.

¬†

I have now created 3 projects in the project log that haven‚Äôt been signed off but under investigation:

¬†

 1. 3T Integration- Excel download from F2 > [REDACTED NAME] is looking at the excel export you require from F2 this week. Once we have more details we can get this scheduled in for development.

You have already noted that this will save you 20mins ‚Äì 3 hours a day depending on volume. Can you define those figures a little more:

 a. What volumes you at now? Including revenue
 b. Where do you expect the volumes to: [REDACTED NAME] in 1 month/2 month/3months and 6 months?

¬†

Additionally, is there any updates required in F2 for the finance team?

¬†

 2. Reload for contract Logistics > The question for this is do we add a new area in F2 for this or keep in reload. Under investigation.
     a. How much change is actually required compared with Reload?
     b. Can you scope something up for us, happily sit with you on this, need more of an insight in what you require.
     c. From: [REDACTED NAME] you note the time saving benefit for yourself and [REDACTED NAME], will this impact the customers in anyway?

¬†

 3. 3T Integration via API > This is on HOLD until figures have increased to a level that Directors sign off. API‚Äôs do take time to: [REDACTED NAME] with the current pipeline for FL customer service this will be lower priority until we see those volumes pick up.

¬†

Please note I have little knowledge on the Reload part of F2 so this will be a good learning exercise for me.

¬†

Kind regards

¬†

redactedMessages.subject: Sales source etc
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, it‚Äôs a lot more complex than a simple ‚Äúsales source‚Äù. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.

¬†

The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales‚Ä¶.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.

¬†

I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a ¬†‚Äúhouse account‚Äù. Hence the reason converted by ‚ÄúX‚Äù 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. ¬†

¬†

Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc [REDACTED NAME] produced is also attached.

¬†

Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.

¬†

My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. It‚Äôs not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest that‚Äôs the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.

¬†

However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope that‚Äôs all helpful.

¬†

Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: 28 November 2025 13:32
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: FW: Follow Up on our meeting - 20th august

¬†

Hello [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

Thank you for our call earlier, it‚Äôs always a pleasure to: [REDACTED NAME] with you.

¬†

As mentioned, I‚Äôm forwarding the email containing the minutes from: [REDACTED NAME] during John and [REDACTED NAME]'s visit to Germany, along with an outstanding request.

¬†

Firstly, the number on our UTA Feery page (+[REDACTED PHONE] 691) needs to: [REDACTED NAME], as our colleague informed me that we no longer use this number and there is no replacement.

¬†

Additionally, if you‚Äôve updated your company address due to: [REDACTED NAME] office, please share the new address with us. It‚Äôs important that we update our systems and make a minor amendment to: [REDACTED NAME], especially for when we receive invoices from Freightlink.

Lastly, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSign? If so, I will include your email address in the signature process.

¬†

¬†

Thank you in advance for your support.

¬†

¬†

Best regards,

[REDACTED NAME]

¬†

Von: [REDACTED NAME]
Gesendet: Montag, 15. September 2025 15:48
An: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>; John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Betreff: AW: Follow Up on our meeting - 20th august

¬†

Hello [REDACTED NAME], John,

¬†

I hope you are doing great.

Following up on our meeting in August, I just wanted to: [REDACTED NAME] you and your IT colleagues had the chance to: [REDACTED NAME] our API specifications I‚Äôve send on the 25th of August.

¬†

I also would like to: [REDACTED NAME] it‚Äôs possible to: [REDACTED NAME] yellow marked phone number from: [REDACTED NAME]:



¬†

According to: [REDACTED NAME] care agents we don‚Äôt use that phone number anymore and there is also no other phone number replacing that one.

¬†

Many thanks in advance.

¬†

Best regards,
[REDACTED NAME]

¬†

Von: [REDACTED NAME]
Gesendet: Montag, 25. August 2025 15:41
An: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>; John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Betreff: Follow Up on our meeting - 20th august

¬†

Dear [REDACTED NAME] and John,

¬†

Thank you both for your visit to Kleinostheim. It was a pleasure to: [REDACTED NAME] here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.

¬†

I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:

¬†

Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * [REDACTED NAME], needs to: [REDACTED NAME] API Specification ([REDACTED NAME]) to Freightlink. Please find attached.
 * Freightlink should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.
 * Freightlink and UTA need to: [REDACTED NAME] use cases, with each party contributing their requirements.

Some points to: [REDACTED NAME] for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)

¬†

Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through UTA Ferry.
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to: [REDACTED NAME]?
 * John and I still need to: [REDACTED NAME] pricing and conditions.
 * [REDACTED NAME] will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a ‚ÄúHow To‚Äù document for sales.

¬†

Sales Training:

 * Training sessions will be organized by region after we finalize the customs link and declarations in UTA Ferry.

¬†

In the UTA Ferry Portal:

 * Replace box 3 with the Irish Ferries offer.
 * Offer on Dover-Calais at [REDACTED AMOUNT] via Irish Ferries.
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for [REDACTED AMOUNT] via DFDS, remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.

¬†

Offers - John:

 * Irish Ferries
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services

¬†

Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] unaccompanied service to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

UTA Tolls:

 * Support Freightlink with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.

¬†

Monthly Reporting:

 * Freightlink will generate monthly reports to: [REDACTED NAME] with UTA.

¬†

Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through UTA Ferry
 * Mandatory declarations

¬†

¬†

Additionally, in case you‚Äôve changed your address due to: [REDACTED NAME] office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to: [REDACTED NAME]. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from Freightlink, that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to: [REDACTED NAME] for Freightlink?

¬†

A follow-up meeting at the end of September to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

I look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] you.

¬†

¬†

Best regards,

[REDACTED NAME]

¬†

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]¬†

Strategic Partner Management

Partner Manager Plus Services
T/¬†+ [REDACTED PHONE]-192

M/ +49 [REDACTED PHONE]
[REDACTED URL]
UNION TANK Eckstein GmbH & Co. KG
Heinrich-Eckstein-Str.¬†1 - [REDACTED REF]¬†Kleinostheim - Germany

redactedMessages.subject: Re: SMM 14/15th May
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

We have changed the strategic element at the end of the day. [REDACTED NAME], I know you are under MEGA pressure, we will supply mins for the meeting if that‚Äôs OK. Will give you a couple of hours back.

¬†

1. OPENING BRIEFING: 12:30 ‚Äì 12:40

v¬† General Information/ Business status; Group/SL news

v¬† Key objectives for today/ tomorrow; any additional items for the agenda?

¬†

2. Minutes: 12:40 ‚Äì 13:30

v¬† Minutes 17th April. ALL:¬† Kindly update minutes by 9th May.

¬†

3. Finance & Performance Review: 13:30 ‚Äì 14:30 [REDACTED NAME] / [REDACTED NAME]

v¬† 13:30 ‚Äì 14:00 [REDACTED NAME] - Finance report presentation ‚Äì April; May forward view. Note: Aged debt review at future SMM meetings? Pending ‚Äì see 20.11.24.02.

v¬† 14:00 ‚Äì 14:30 [REDACTED NAME] Statistical analytics ‚Äì presentation of data stats. (results & trends vs. budget & LY. Variances etc.).

v¬† Included in above Supplier & customer performance ‚Äì Trading results, Market Share Competitor Activities/ Market Watch.

¬†

Break 15 mins

4. HR: 14:45 ‚Äì 15:15 [REDACTED NAME] / [REDACTED NAME]

v¬† Organisation updates and monthly HR report; MBO‚Äôs

¬†

5. Strategic Forum: 15:15 ‚Äì 17:00 ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] / [REDACTED NAME] / [REDACTED NAME] 15-1600hrs

 * Focus on growth Hercules
 * John Gaskell 1600hrs ‚Äì 1700hrs commercial strategic pathway

¬†

AOB

¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

¬†

¬†

Please find attached proposed AGENDA for the SMM Meeting last week. If you would like to: [REDACTED NAME] items or change anything please let me know.

¬†

In the meantime, I also attach a copy of the minutes from: [REDACTED NAME] last month. Obviously with the distractions prevailing at the time of the previous meeting there is a need to: [REDACTED NAME] minutes as much as possible before we meet up next week. I‚Äôve highlighted all OPEN ITEMS previously allocated to: [REDACTED NAME] yellow ‚Äì we need to: [REDACTED NAME] will happen to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.

¬†

As usual the HoT reports should be with me this week so that I can submit my report.

¬†

All the best, [REDACTED NAME] thanks, [REDACTED NAME]

Subject: CloudFlare Account Changes

Hi [REDACTED NAME] and Robbie

¬†

I hope you‚Äôre both well.

¬†

I‚Äôve just had a chat with [REDACTED NAME], an engineer at our Node4, our hosting infrastructure provider. As you know, one feature that Node4 provide for you is CloudFlare protection to: [REDACTED NAME] DDoS attacks.

¬†

John wanted to: [REDACTED NAME] know that CloudFlare are making some changes to the ‚ÄúResaler account‚Äù that Node4 have with CloudFlare, and how these changes affect Seatruck Ferries.

¬†

I think it would be useful if we were able to have a call to: [REDACTED NAME] the changes and to: [REDACTED NAME] options. These changes start coming into effect at the end of October, and while we won‚Äôt see any real differences in November, there are implications that you need to understand, so a call sooner rather than later would be best.

¬†

redactedMessages.subject: SL Strategy Nov 23 Deck
redactedMessages.body:
[REDACTED NAME],

¬†

Scores on the doors so far!

¬†

 1. October Highlights ‚Äì I have updated the Performance, belt and braces, so this can be cut down but having this info to: [REDACTED NAME] case any questions are asked might be useful.
 2. Development - According to [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs last update for discussion with [REDACTED NAME] all was with her to: [REDACTED NAME] update. Chased her twice but nothing yet. I have attached the latest pipeline report but way too big and very difficult to understand. Hopefully, she will have a more digestible FL & CL split I can add tomorrow.
 3. ETS - Most up to: [REDACTED NAME] I/we have in [REDACTED NAME] absence. I have updated the Stena Nov 2023 data(it has reduced slightly and added the Nov Data for ColorLine and IF. ¬†

John,

¬†

Thanks, [REDACTED NAME] attached, great starting point for our discussions!

¬†

Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] time and money to: [REDACTED NAME] results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and the Team, but it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!

[REDACTED NAME].

¬†

From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics

¬†

Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time

¬†

1 ‚Äì Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, GL, DHL, Mardix, why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to: [REDACTED NAME] inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levels‚Äîthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the company‚Äôs core competency if messaging isn‚Äôt clear and unified ‚Äì IE Reload is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isn‚Äôt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to: [REDACTED NAME] and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, there‚Äôs a risk of internal competition for the same business

¬†

2 ‚Äì If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to: [REDACTED NAME] this, I would need the bandwidth, ¬†autonomy and resource to do, I can‚Äôt win business and not be able to deliver.
    * DHL prime example ‚Äì I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasn‚Äôt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasn‚Äôt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to: [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to: [REDACTED NAME] design tools similar to: [REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì we don‚Äôt do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isn‚Äôt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. ¬†
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to: [REDACTED NAME] and have the workload to: [REDACTED NAME] the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. ¬†

¬†

3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to: [REDACTED NAME] transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects

¬†

This is unfortunately the reality of how logistics work, with very fine margins, high work levels and little reward, a lot of business is won on costs alone, and is a good fit for primary work already in place.

¬†

T:¬†[REDACTED PHONE]

W:¬†freightlink.co.uk

A:¬†[REDACTED ADDRESS]



John Gaskell

Head Of Sales and Contract Logistics

redactedMessages.subject: Commercial role
redactedMessages.body:
Gents,

¬†

As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CV‚Äôs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] role‚Ä¶whilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as ‚ÄúX‚Äù learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. It‚Äôs a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !

¬†

I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs knowledge of ‚ÄúCUSTOMS‚Äù is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.

¬†

So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg‚Ä¶.it is not a finished product !

¬†

See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-

¬†

 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here ‚Äúoffice manager‚Äù so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill Jens role with a relatively lower salaried project manager ¬£ 30k - ¬£ 35K ‚Äì see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan ‚Äì so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners ‚Äì I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR‚Ä¶2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I don‚Äôt have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2 ‚Äì the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K ‚Äì his old job was ¬£ 90k)

redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means we‚Äôre not in a position to: [REDACTED NAME] packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and you‚Äôll also benefit from: [REDACTED NAME] work from: [REDACTED NAME] following John‚Äôs departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to: [REDACTED NAME] hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, it‚Äôs vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to: [REDACTED NAME] you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, we‚Äôve struggled to: [REDACTED NAME] this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To: [REDACTED NAME], we need to: [REDACTED NAME] a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. We cannot afford to: [REDACTED NAME] a plan that isn‚Äôt delivering results. If something isn‚Äôt working, we need to: [REDACTED NAME]‚Äîquickly and decisively.¬†
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Let‚Äôs work together to: [REDACTED NAME] have a robust framework in place to: [REDACTED NAME] drive performance.¬†
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary [REDACTED AMOUNT] plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target [REDACTED AMOUNT] per month (as discussed [REDACTED NAME] will agree these with you)
 * 01st Jan 2026 [REDACTED AMOUNT] (10.5% / [REDACTED AMOUNT])



For 2026, we will also amend your monthly targets as follows. This provides you with an easier initial target to hit (on budget), plus the ability to: [REDACTED NAME] more bonus as your overachieve.

redactedMessages.subject: Re: SLA/OLA
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

Working late. Bravo.

¬†

I think this is a good starting point. Well done !!!!

¬†

No it didn‚Äôt come up‚Ä¶.it really should have done. I will raise this with [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Like the OLA angle ‚Äì makes sense. Perfect !

The basic structure is sound. Well done ‚Äì you are very good at these.

¬†

Each OLA needs to: [REDACTED NAME] specific.

¬†

Eg Item 1 ‚Äì ‚ÄúSales will do this, including this level of information, via this method of communication to Operations, and the desired output is that. Time frame to: [REDACTED NAME] X‚Äù

¬†

Imagine you are writing a set of instructions for a new starter ‚Äì it must be that level of detail.

¬†

I am not sure who has given you a steer on the ‚Äúitems‚Äù to: [REDACTED NAME] within the OLA. I think this need clearing up. I am guessing this will be [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME] to finalise.

¬†

Unlike a policy, I would make sure that the HOT are the signatories on this rather than directors. Make them responsible. If you want directors sign off, I recommend that the director responsible for the teams this impact signs off. EG In this instance, [REDACTED NAME] and I. We need visibility and understanding.

¬†

I don‚Äôt want to: [REDACTED NAME] be negative, but [REDACTED NAME] will not be dealing with any items like this until mid-April unfortunately. Perhaps when you discuss with [REDACTED NAME] ? We are really under resourced over the next few months. I have already told [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME], other departments will have to: [REDACTED NAME] strain.

¬†

Ordinarily, I would be happy to: [REDACTED NAME] write this, but I must focus on my targets. I feel rubbish saying that..I hope that‚Äôs ok! 100% keep running things past me, I am delighted to help.

¬†

I hope you have a good few days off [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

It was good to: [REDACTED NAME] earlier in the week on a few ongoing matters.¬† As discussed, I have now had the chance to: [REDACTED NAME] proposal for the various matters discussed.¬† I have itemised these as follows and provided a retainer proposal in addition, translating the itemised proposals into hours which you could use in the retainer if you wished to: [REDACTED NAME] this.

[REDACTED NAME]

 1. Marimosa ‚Äì it is understood that this matter may not need to: [REDACTED NAME] further.¬† We agreed on a fixed fee of [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT for that work, which we would discount by the percentage corresponding to: [REDACTED NAME] option which you chose should you proceed with that.¬† We‚Äôd then translate that discounted figure into the corresponding number of hours at the discounted hourly rates under the retainer.¬† Put simply, if you opted for a 4 hour retainer then we would discount by 15% to [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT and at my hourly rate of [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT under the retainer, this would equate to 4.5 hours.

¬†

 2. T&Cs Update ‚Äì I anticipate this taking no more than 1 hour of time, reviewing whether there are any consequential amendments required in addition to: [REDACTED NAME] required additional provisions regarding refunds and for certainty would be happy to: [REDACTED NAME] at this amount (and therefore [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT).¬† Under the 4 hour retainer, this would benefit from a 15% discount.

¬†

 3. White Label Agreement ‚Äì as mentioned, we created a form of WLA for CustomsLink to: [REDACTED NAME] relationship with the RHA and notwithstanding that this was a heavily negotiated document, we can utilise this as a starting point for creating a similar version for FLS.¬† There will be a degree of work to ‚Äòdecompile‚Äô where we arrived with RHA and to: [REDACTED NAME] it properly suits the needs of FLS (meanwhile reviewing the other form of WLA which has been being used to: [REDACTED NAME] useful provisions).¬† I would estimate 6.5 ‚Äì 7.5 hours but for certainty, would be happy to: [REDACTED NAME] at 7.5 hours (and therefore [REDACTED AMOUNT] + VAT).¬† Under the 4 hour retainer, this would benefit from a 15% discount.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

¬†

As stated above, I have attached our retainer proposal.¬† As you‚Äôll see, we have set out (Partner-led) options varying from 4 up to 10 hours per month with discounts on our normal hourly rates increasing, the more hours you opt for.¬† I would suggest that with a start date of 1 June, a 4 hour retainer may be of benefit at the outset if you did wish to: [REDACTED NAME] up and I would be happy to: [REDACTED NAME] the Marimosa work and the above work into this in line with the hours stated.¬† I‚Äôd also wrap up our AS24 file and include any further work on that project within the retainer too from: [REDACTED NAME] forwards.¬† The attached should explain how the retainer works but as stated, you may roll over unused time and additional time would be charged at the discounted ‚Äòadditional rate‚Äô.¬† Under retainers, we raise our first invoice after 3 months so as to: [REDACTED NAME] the increased amount of initial work which we typically fine and ensure that you benefit from: [REDACTED NAME] value.

I look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] you.

redactedMessages.body:
From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2024 3:57 PM
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Incoterm query

¬†

Good afternoon [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

I hope your keeping well, following on from: [REDACTED NAME] we discussed getting a ‚Äòdummy account‚Äô for us to: [REDACTED NAME] and familiarise ourselves with so we can push the service when required to: [REDACTED NAME], and can talk it through to: [REDACTED NAME] encourage them to: [REDACTED NAME] new service, is it possible for this to: [REDACTED NAME] up?.

¬†

On a secondary note, we have had a query from a member regarding Incoterms, as per below:

¬†

‚ÄòAs just discussed on the phone, we have quoted our customers based on FCA Germany, where the customer is collecting the material from: [REDACTED NAME] in Germany, who is responsible for the export clearance‚Äô ?

¬†

The member is a UK based company, and their customer is also UK based, the material is manufactured in Germany, the member quoted the customer FCA Germany, and they are arranging collection.

¬†

It is our understanding that unless otherwise agreed upon, the seller is only responsible for loading the goods if the seller‚Äôs place of business is the named place of delivery.

¬†

Can you shed any light or have a person within your team that would know this, I am happy to: [REDACTED NAME] member contact: [REDACTED NAME] we have dealt with this query for their future requirements.

¬†

Also, I am not sure a UK based company can actually perform export declarations on the German customs portal, or are they allowed.

¬†

Unfortunately, whenever customs or exporting comes in as a question we do refer members to a specialist customs agent and try not to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Any help you can give will be greatly received.

¬†

Kind Regards, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]
Manager - Compliance Information
Logistics UK

redactedMessages.body:
Already had the conversation.

¬†

I have told John that [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs probation needs to: [REDACTED NAME], that may result in him making his own decision. He knows that discussion needs to: [REDACTED NAME] this week. We have had several really robust discussions, and I have told him to: [REDACTED NAME] on the vehicles but to: [REDACTED NAME] any work we currently have can be covered, we will do that before the end of next week.

¬†

We discussed that the budget is the budget, and we need a strategy/recovery plan and this will be down to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics solution. If it means we need another planner then so be it but as you point out [REDACTED NAME] is a very expensive asset and with the current performance in Reload we have lots of capacity internally.

¬†

He is pulling together a plan over the next few days and said we would sit down to have a high-level conversation before you return with a more in-depth decision making session on your return.

¬†

This for all the wrong reasons gives us the opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] amalgamating the 2 teams, neither in their current form have enough work so we need to act. [REDACTED NAME] is on annual leave at the moment, that won‚Äôt have helped the figures as we know he manufacturers a quieter period when he, [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME] are on leave.

¬†

Some very difficult but very important swift decisions need to: [REDACTED NAME], and he is more than aware of the situation. Our first conversation this morning [REDACTED NAME] about his long term job security so he is in no doubt of the gravity of the situation. Date: Tuesday, 21 November 2023 at 22:22
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Commercial role

Gents,

¬†

As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CV‚Äôs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] role‚Ä¶whilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as ‚ÄúX‚Äù learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. It‚Äôs a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !

¬†

I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs knowledge of ‚ÄúCUSTOMS‚Äù is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.

¬†

So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg‚Ä¶.it is not a finished product !

¬†

See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-

¬†

 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here ‚Äúoffice manager‚Äù so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill [REDACTED NAME] role with a relatively lower salaried project manager ¬£ 30k - ¬£ 35K ‚Äì see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan ‚Äì so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners ‚Äì I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR‚Ä¶2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I don‚Äôt have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2 ‚Äì the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K ‚Äì his old job was ¬£ 90k)
 h. WILD CARD ‚Äì is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through ‚Äì but smells like 70K ????

¬†

I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I don‚Äôt, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the Stena Line POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. ¬†

¬†

For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.

¬†

I really hope this helps in some way.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

redactedMessages.body:
From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2024 3:57 PM
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Incoterm query

¬†

Good afternoon [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

I hope your keeping well, following on from: [REDACTED NAME] we discussed getting a ‚Äòdummy account‚Äô for us to: [REDACTED NAME] and familiarise ourselves with so we can push the service when required to: [REDACTED NAME], and can talk it through to: [REDACTED NAME] encourage them to: [REDACTED NAME] new service, is it possible for this to: [REDACTED NAME] up?.

¬†

On a secondary note, we have had a query from a member regarding Incoterms, as per below:

¬†

‚ÄòAs just discussed on the phone, we have quoted our customers based on FCA Germany, where the customer is collecting the material from: [REDACTED NAME] in Germany, who is responsible for the export clearance‚Äô ?

¬†

The member is a UK based company, and their customer is also UK based, the material is manufactured in Germany, the member quoted the customer FCA Germany, and they are arranging collection.

¬†

It is our understanding that unless otherwise agreed upon, the seller is only responsible for loading the goods if the seller‚Äôs place of business is the named place of delivery.

¬†

Can you shed any light or have a person within your team that would know this, I am happy to: [REDACTED NAME] member contact: [REDACTED NAME] we have dealt with this query for their future requirements.

¬†

Also, I am not sure a UK based company can actually perform export declarations on the German customs portal, or are they allowed.

¬†

Unfortunately, whenever customs or exporting comes in as a question we do refer members to a specialist customs agent and try not to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Any help you can give will be greatly received.

¬†

Kind Regards, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]
Manager - Compliance Information
Logistics UK
Phone: [REDACTED PHONE]

[REDACTED URL].uk

¬†
¬†¬†¬†

redactedMessages.subject: Re: System improvements / ideas
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

Can I just manage expectations and underline some parts from: [REDACTED NAME] email.

¬†

So ‚Äì as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a ‚ÄúVALUE‚Äù and we compare that against all the developments within the business.

¬†

You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these ‚Äì eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.

¬†

Example - ¬†I have a live example of a request I have rejected ‚Äì Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. I have done a quick calculation, and that development would assist us in less than .5% of all bookings. The actual dev would take 3-4 days. We don‚Äôt have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200 ‚Äì we have to: [REDACTED NAME] manually somehow. The developments we MUST focus on are the ones to: [REDACTED NAME] team blockers, and that‚Äôs what I will focus on.

¬†

This is YOUR team, managing YOUR pipeline in terms of priority. I am here to: [REDACTED NAME] process.

¬†

I don‚Äôt want this appear to: [REDACTED NAME], you team need to: [REDACTED NAME] do anything and everything to help‚Ä¶.but you guys must help yourselves in terms of organising the priority. So from: [REDACTED NAME] below ‚Äì what are your TOP 3 in terms of delivering the highest value, and why ?

¬†

Can you chase up all the Team leaders for their recommendations and lets see and come up multiple times üòâ

¬†

BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

¬†

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Wednesday, 22 May 2024 at 12:11
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: System improvements / ideas

Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

¬†

Implementing several of these suggestions would undoubtedly benefit both the team and other departments.

¬†

¬†

ENS builder (how and when can we make it fully automated?).

ENS builder ‚Äì Stena Line forms to: [REDACTED NAME] and validated. The team shouldn‚Äôt be handling it.

redactedMessages.subject: FW: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics
redactedMessages.body:
FYI ‚Äì See highlighted

¬†

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Sent: 29 July 2025 14:22
To: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Subject: RE: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics

¬†

John,

¬†

Thanks, [REDACTED NAME] attached, great starting point for our discussions!

¬†

Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] time and money to: [REDACTED NAME] results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and the Team, but it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!

¬†

[REDACTED NAME].

¬†

From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics

¬†

Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time

¬†

1 ‚Äì Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, GL, DHL, Mardix, why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to: [REDACTED NAME] inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levels‚Äîthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the company‚Äôs core competency if messaging isn‚Äôt clear and unified ‚Äì IE Reload is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isn‚Äôt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to: [REDACTED NAME] and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, there‚Äôs a risk of internal competition for the same business

¬†

2 ‚Äì If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to: [REDACTED NAME] this, I would need the bandwidth, ¬†autonomy and resource to do, I can‚Äôt win business and not be able to deliver.
    * DHL prime example ‚Äì I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasn‚Äôt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasn‚Äôt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to: [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to: [REDACTED NAME] design tools similar to: [REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì we don‚Äôt do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isn‚Äôt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. ¬†
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to: [REDACTED NAME] and have the workload to: [REDACTED NAME] the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. ¬†

¬†

3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to: [REDACTED NAME] transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects

¬†

This is unfortunately the reality of how logistics work, with very fine margins, high work levels and little reward, a lot of business is won on costs alone, and is a good fit for primary work already in place.

¬†

E:¬†john@freightlink.co.uk

T:¬†[REDACTED PHONE]

W:¬†freightlink.co.uk

A:¬†[REDACTED ADDRESS]



John Gaskell

Head Of Sales and Contract Logistics

¬†

Company registration number [REDACTED REF] | [REDACTED VAT].¬†Email Disclaimer¬†|¬†Privacy¬†|¬†Terms & Conditions

All business is transacted under the current edition of the BIFA Standard Trading Conditions.

¬†

Cc: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Re: Without prejudice -Subject to: [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]¬†

¬†

Thank you for your email. For the purpose of clarity, I wish to: [REDACTED NAME] record the following:

‚Ä¢ At no point have I requested, nor raised concerns, regarding my post-termination clauses with Freightlink Solutions.

‚Ä¢ This matter was initiated solely by an email from [REDACTED NAME], asking me to sign a post-termination clause to: [REDACTED NAME].

‚Ä¢ Upon my non-acceptance of this request, the company proceeded with what I consider emotional blackmail by targeting my daughter, restricting her employment opportunities, career development, and even threatening her future employment, by a non-existent conflict of interest .

‚Ä¢ It was this action that prompted me, voluntarily, to: [REDACTED NAME] assurance limited to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

That said, I confirm that the amended agreement you have now provided is broadly acceptable, subject to: [REDACTED NAME] changes for your review.

¬†

 * This must state it replaces Part 3 vi, by mutual agreement, for the 6-month term.¬†

Thank you both for your visit to Kleinostheim. It was a pleasure to: [REDACTED NAME] here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.

¬†

I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:

¬†

Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * [REDACTED NAME], needs to: [REDACTED NAME] API Specification ([REDACTED NAME]) to Freightlink. Please find attached.
 * Freightlink should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.

Some points to: [REDACTED NAME] for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)

¬†

Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through UTA Ferry.
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to: [REDACTED NAME]?
 * John and I still need to: [REDACTED NAME] pricing and conditions.
 * [REDACTED NAME] will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a ‚ÄúHow To‚Äù document for sales.

¬†

Sales Training:

¬†

In the UTA Ferry Portal:

 * Offer on Dover-Calais at [REDACTED AMOUNT] via Irish Ferries.
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for [REDACTED AMOUNT] via DFDS, remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.

¬†

Offers - John:

 * Irish Ferries
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services

¬†

Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] unaccompanied service to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

UTA Tolls:

 * Support Freightlink with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.

¬†

Monthly Reporting:

 * Freightlink will generate monthly reports to: [REDACTED NAME] with UTA.

¬†

Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through UTA Ferry
 * Mandatory declarations

¬†

¬†

Additionally, in case you‚Äôve changed your address due to: [REDACTED NAME] office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to: [REDACTED NAME]. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from Freightlink, that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to: [REDACTED NAME] for Freightlink?

¬†

A follow-up meeting at the end of September to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

I look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] you.

¬†

¬†

Best regards,

[REDACTED NAME]

To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Sales source etc

Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, it‚Äôs a lot more complex than a simple ‚Äúsales source‚Äù. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.

¬†

The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales‚Ä¶.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.

¬†

I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a ¬†‚Äúhouse account‚Äù. Hence the reason converted by ‚ÄúX‚Äù 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. ¬†

¬†

Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc Fiona produced is also attached.

¬†

Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.

¬†

My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. It‚Äôs not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest that‚Äôs the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.

¬†

However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope that‚Äôs all helpful.

¬†

Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

Hi [REDACTED NAME],

I wanted to take a moment to: [REDACTED NAME] disappointment after learning about the upcoming appointment of the Operations Director, particularly after reviewing the job advertisement and realising how closely my experience and achievements align with the criteria for the role.

¬†

Having been with the business for almost four years, I‚Äôve worked hard and tirelessly to: [REDACTED NAME] its growth and success.

A few key highlights include:

‚Ä¢ Securing Prince‚Äôs work worth over [REDACTED AMOUNT] million and ensuring we succeed in its delivery.

‚Ä¢ Being on the verge of closing a transport deal worth approximately [REDACTED AMOUNT]

‚Ä¢ Bringing in additional business valued at over [REDACTED AMOUNT]

‚Ä¢ Promoting a culture of ownership and proper customer service

‚Ä¢ Delivering both AEO and ISO accreditations

‚Ä¢ Ensuring accounts receive the support they need, being available 24/7 for customers

‚Ä¢ Successfully delivering multiple projects, with the support and collaboration of the wider team

¬†

Whilst I know I may not always make the most popular of decisions I firmly believe I make the right decisions for the good of the business and these results reflect my ongoing commitment, commercial understanding, and ability to: [REDACTED NAME] operational and financial outcomes.

¬†

That‚Äôs why I must be honest, I‚Äôm extremely disappointed to: [REDACTED NAME] completely overlooked for consideration for this position. After everything I‚Äôve invested into this business, both personally and professionally, it‚Äôs disheartening to: [REDACTED NAME] my efforts and capabilities have not been recognised at this level.

¬†

I understand I made myself clear a few weeks back regarding my future however like John, I‚Äôve started to: [REDACTED NAME] I fit within the company‚Äôs future plans. While I fully respect your decision-making process, I cannot hide how disheartened I feel, nor my growing concern that I may no longer have a future here if my contributions are not being acknowledged.

¬†

Re: Garden Leave and Ongoing Contractual Obligations

I am writing to: [REDACTED NAME] our conversation on Monday 20th October 2025.¬†Under your notice period, your final date of employment with our organisation would have been 30th December 2025. However, instead of you working out your notice period, we have decided to: [REDACTED NAME] on¬†garden leave¬†from 20th October 2025 in accordance with clause 21 of your Employment Contract.

¬†

This means that you will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] pay and benefits (with the exception of benefits that are given to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] job, such as a work mobile phone or car allowance) in the normal way. You remain bound by all the obligations and restrictions set out in your Employment Contract, save the duty to: [REDACTED NAME]. You will not be allowed to: [REDACTED NAME] work and must stay away from: [REDACTED NAME] during the¬†garden leave¬†period. During the¬†garden leave¬†period, you are not permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] other employment and are required to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] by our organisation and to: [REDACTED NAME] work requested by our organisation.

¬†

I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] that you are still bound by the obligations and restrictions set out in clauses below of your Employment Contract. For the avoidance of doubt, I set out below the clauses that apply:

¬†

 * Part 1, Clause 16: Confidential Information: You are strictly prohibited from disclosing, using, or retaining any confidential information acquired during the course of your employment. This obligation survives termination and is enforceable under both contractual and common law principles.
 * Part 1, Clause 21: Garden Leave:¬†During any period of Garden Leave, you will remain an employee of the Company and bound by the terms of your contract.¬†You must remain available to: [REDACTED NAME] any reasonable requests from: [REDACTED NAME], including attending meetings or providing information. All accrued unused holiday entitlement will be taken during Garden Leave. You must not contact: [REDACTED NAME] with the named parties in vii, or take alternative employment during Garden Leave without explicit consent from us.
 * Part 1, Clause 10 and Part 3: Post Termination Restrictions: Upon termination of your employment, you will be subject to: [REDACTED NAME] covenants set out in your contract, including but not limited to:
   * Non-compete obligations prohibiting engagement in any business that competes with Freightlink Solutions Limited.
   * Non-solicitation and non-dealing clauses relating to clients, customers, suppliers, and employees of the Company.
 * Conduct: You are expected to: [REDACTED NAME] conduct and refrain from: [REDACTED NAME] that may cause reputational, operational, or commercial harm to: [REDACTED NAME] Limited.

Any breach of these obligations will be treated as a serious matter. Freightlink Solutions Limited reserves the right to: [REDACTED NAME] available legal remedies, including injunctive relief, damages, and costs, without further notice.

This letter is issued without prejudice to: [REDACTED NAME] or remedies the Company may have under contract or law.

Should you have any questions regarding your obligations during garden leave, please XXXX.

Yours sincerely,

Good morning [REDACTED NAME],

Apologies for the delay in responding‚ÄîI was awaiting further advice.

We will address each of the three matters separately rather than combining them into a single email.

Non-Compete Agreement

Regarding the non-compete agreement received, I am unable to: [REDACTED NAME] in its current form. The draft I briefly reviewed last Thursday included a defined time frame, whereas the version provided does not, and it also contains additional clauses that I did not propose or agree to.

As I am voluntarily entering into this agreement, I request the following amendments:

 * Removal of Sections 1, 2, and 3, as I did not agree to: [REDACTED NAME]. I remain aware of my existing contractual obligations, and this non-compete should serve only as an addition to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement.
 * Explicit statement that I am receiving no remuneration and that this agreement is voluntary.
 * A defined time limit, ending on 30 March 2026.
 * Clarification that I am signing to: [REDACTED NAME] and my daughter, [REDACTED NAME], ensuring normal working practices can continue and avoiding any conflict of interest.
 * Competitor companies must be specifically listed and limited to: [REDACTED NAME]. The current wording ‚Äúnot limited to‚Äù is too open to interpretation.

Dear [REDACTED NAME] and John,

¬†

Thank you both for your visit to Kleinostheim. It was a pleasure to: [REDACTED NAME] here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.

¬†

I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:

¬†

Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * [REDACTED NAME], needs to: [REDACTED NAME] API Specification ([REDACTED NAME]) to Freightlink. Please find attached.
 * Freightlink should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.
 * Freightlink and UTA need to: [REDACTED NAME] use cases, with each party contributing their requirements.

Some points to: [REDACTED NAME] for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)

¬†

Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through UTA Ferry.
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to: [REDACTED NAME]?
 * John and I still need to: [REDACTED NAME] pricing and conditions.
 * [REDACTED NAME] will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a ‚ÄúHow To‚Äù document for sales.

¬†

Sales Training:

 * Training sessions will be organized by region after we finalize the customs link and declarations in UTA Ferry.

¬†

In the UTA Ferry Portal:

 * Replace box 3 with the Irish Ferries offer.
 * Offer on Dover-Calais at [REDACTED AMOUNT] via Irish Ferries.
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for [REDACTED AMOUNT] via DFDS, remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.

¬†

Offers - John:

 * Irish Ferries
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services

¬†

Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] unaccompanied service to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

UTA Tolls:

 * Support Freightlink with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.

¬†

Monthly Reporting:

 * Freightlink will generate monthly reports to: [REDACTED NAME] with UTA.

¬†

Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through UTA Ferry
 * Mandatory declarations

¬†

¬†

Additionally, in case you‚Äôve changed your address due to: [REDACTED NAME] office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to: [REDACTED NAME]. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from Freightlink, that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to: [REDACTED NAME] for Freightlink?

A follow-up meeting at the end of September to: [REDACTED NAME].

I look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] you.

¬†

Dear [REDACTED NAME] and John,

¬†

Thank you both for your visit to Kleinostheim. It was a pleasure to: [REDACTED NAME] here, and I hope you had a safe journey home.

¬†

I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] topics we discussed and outline the actions I am already working on:

¬†

Online Authorization - Phase 2:

 * [REDACTED NAME], needs to: [REDACTED NAME] API Specification ([REDACTED NAME]) to Freightlink. Please find attached.
 * Freightlink should share the email addresses required for accessing our API console. There you will find the OAuth and the API Keys that can be generated.
 * Freightlink and UTA need to: [REDACTED NAME] use cases, with each party contributing their requirements.

Some points to: [REDACTED NAME] for the use cases:

 * Card authorization for immediate bookings,
 * Cancellation of bookings,
 * Card authorization for future crossings,
 * Transaction file generation.

(Our API Specification currently covers the first two scenarios: booking and crossing in the near future, as well as cancellations.)

¬†

Customs Link/Declarations:

 * There will be no registration fees for UTA customers accessing the customs link through UTA Ferry.
 * Declarations can be generated entirely (import, export) via the customs link, including future declarations such as SSGB, ENS, ELO, and ICS2.
 * Customs services will be available digitally for the following countries: UK, Germany, France, Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, and Portugal. No on-site offices are involved.
 * John, could you please provide more information on additional customs services available to: [REDACTED NAME]?
 * John and I still need to: [REDACTED NAME] pricing and conditions.
 * [REDACTED NAME] will send an email regarding the new ELO declarations and a ‚ÄúHow To‚Äù document for sales.

¬†

Sales Training:

 * Training sessions will be organized by region after we finalize the customs link and declarations in UTA Ferry.

¬†

In the UTA Ferry Portal:

 * Replace box 3 with the Irish Ferries offer.
 * Offer on Dover-Calais at [REDACTED AMOUNT] via Irish Ferries.
 * The offer on Dover-Calais and Dover-Dunkerque, including a free meal on board for [REDACTED AMOUNT] via DFDS, remains unchanged.
 * UTA will reactivate the conditions for Dover-Calais.

¬†

Offers - John:

 * Irish Ferries
 * Price stages for the most popular routes
 * Customs services

¬†

Intermodal Information:

 * I will clarify whether we are permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] unaccompanied service to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

UTA Tolls:

 * Support Freightlink with toll solutions for customers purchasing UTA toll boxes.

¬†

Monthly Reporting:

 * Freightlink will generate monthly reports to: [REDACTED NAME] with UTA.

¬†

Customer Mass Communication:

 * Special offers and better rates on select routes
 * Customs declarations through UTA Ferry
 * Mandatory declarations

¬†

¬†

Additionally, in case you‚Äôve changed your address due to: [REDACTED NAME] office, please send me your new address so we can update our systems and make a small amendment to: [REDACTED NAME]. I think it must be relevant also for when we receive invoices from Freightlink, that we update this information. Also, can the addendum be signed digitally via DocuSing? If so, can I add you, John, to: [REDACTED NAME] for Freightlink?

¬†

A follow-up meeting at the end of September to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

I look forward to: [REDACTED NAME] you.

¬†

¬†

Best regards,

[REDACTED NAME]

¬†

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]¬†

Strategic Partner Management

Partner Manager Plus Services

However, instead of you working out your notice period, we have decided to: [REDACTED NAME] on¬†garden leave¬†from 20th October 2025 in accordance with clause 21 of your Employment Contract.

¬†

This means that you will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] pay and benefits (with the exception of benefits that are given to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] job, such as a work mobile phone or car allowance) in the normal way. You remain bound by all the obligations and restrictions set out in your Employment Contract, save the duty to: [REDACTED NAME]. You will not be allowed to: [REDACTED NAME] work and must stay away from: [REDACTED NAME] during the¬†garden leave¬†period. During the¬†garden leave¬†period, you are not permitted to: [REDACTED NAME] other employment and are required to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] by our organisation and to: [REDACTED NAME] work requested by our organisation.

¬†

I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] that you are still bound by the obligations and restrictions set out in clauses below of your Employment Contract. For the avoidance of doubt, I set out below the clauses that apply:

¬†

 * Part 1, Clause 16: Confidential Information: You are strictly prohibited from disclosing, using, or retaining any confidential information acquired during the course of your employment. This obligation survives termination and is enforceable under both contractual and common law principles.
 * Part 1, Clause 21: Garden Leave:¬†During any period of Garden Leave, you will remain an employee of the Company and bound by the terms of your contract.¬†You must remain available to: [REDACTED NAME] any reasonable requests from: [REDACTED NAME], including attending meetings or providing information. All accrued unused holiday entitlement will be taken during Garden Leave. You must not contact: [REDACTED NAME] with the named parties in vii, or take alternative employment during Garden Leave without explicit consent from us.
 * Part 1, Clause 10 and Part 3: Post Termination Restrictions: Upon termination of your employment, you will be subject to: [REDACTED NAME] covenants set out in your contract, including but not limited to:
   * Non-compete obligations prohibiting engagement in any business that competes with Freightlink Solutions Limited.
   * Non-solicitation and non-dealing clauses relating to clients, customers, suppliers, and employees of the Company.
 * Conduct: You are expected to: [REDACTED NAME] conduct and refrain from: [REDACTED NAME] that may cause reputational, operational, or commercial harm to: [REDACTED NAME] Limited.

Any breach of these obligations will be treated as a serious matter. Freightlink Solutions Limited reserves the right to: [REDACTED NAME] available legal remedies, including injunctive relief, damages, and costs, without further notice.

This letter is issued without prejudice to: [REDACTED NAME] or remedies the Company may have under contract or law.

Should you have any questions regarding your obligations during garden leave, please XXXX.

Yours sincerely,

redactedMessages.subject: Commercial role
redactedMessages.body:
Gents,

¬†

As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CV‚Äôs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] role‚Ä¶whilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as ‚ÄúX‚Äù learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. It‚Äôs a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !

¬†

I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs knowledge of ‚ÄúCUSTOMS‚Äù is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.

¬†

So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg‚Ä¶.it is not a finished product !

¬†

See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-

¬†

 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here ‚Äúoffice manager‚Äù so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill Jens role with a relatively lower salaried project manager ¬£ 30k - ¬£ 35K ‚Äì see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan ‚Äì so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners ‚Äì I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR‚Ä¶2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I don‚Äôt have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2 ‚Äì the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K ‚Äì his old job was ¬£ 90k)
 h. WILD CARD ‚Äì is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through ‚Äì but smells like 70K ????

¬†

I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I don‚Äôt, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the Stena Line POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. ¬†

¬†

For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.

¬†

I really hope this helps in some way.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

redactedMessages.subject: Reload 2026 & personal terms - Confidential
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means we‚Äôre not in a position to: [REDACTED NAME] packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and you‚Äôll also benefit from: [REDACTED NAME] work from: [REDACTED NAME] following John‚Äôs departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to: [REDACTED NAME] hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, it‚Äôs vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to: [REDACTED NAME] you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, we‚Äôve struggled to: [REDACTED NAME] this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To: [REDACTED NAME], we need to: [REDACTED NAME] a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. We cannot afford to: [REDACTED NAME] a plan that isn‚Äôt delivering results. If something isn‚Äôt working, we need to: [REDACTED NAME]‚Äîquickly and decisively.¬†
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Let‚Äôs work together to: [REDACTED NAME] have a robust framework in place to: [REDACTED NAME] drive performance.¬†
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary [REDACTED AMOUNT] plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target [REDACTED AMOUNT] per month (as discussed [REDACTED NAME] will agree these with you)

We absolutely believe you are the right person to: [REDACTED NAME]. If there is anything else we can do to: [REDACTED NAME] please speak up.
