[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì I would like more breathing space, if we look at Aldi talks nobody has got too exited about this one this is ideal and hopefully we can deliver. I have also been chasing up leads that other people have been working on, examples provided include John on Reload and [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] the ATA carnets.  6. AOB

Nothing else to discuss.

As outlined, we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and I have attached the successful completion of your probation letter for use with your mortgage supplier. I am convinced that with extra focus you can achieve but as outlined we need to: [REDACTED NAME] improvement.

[REDACTED NAME],

¬†

I hope you are well and thanks, [REDACTED NAME] time earlier this week, hopefully we got some clarity on the expectations moving forward but let me once again confirm we are absolutely committed to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] moving forward. I have asked [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] overview of the meeting, so we are clear on what was discussed. If he has missed anything or you disagree let me know.¬†

¬†

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

 1. Current Partnership Pipeline

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì If you can provide an overview of where we are currently up to?

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì 14th March we have a board meeting with Stena and we are required to provide a further update by the end of this current week.

¬†

Action ‚Äì Provide [REDACTED NAME] full overview of the current partnership pipeline with an overview on each. Moving forward we need to deliver 9 new(inc current ones)¬† partners and set up a formal onboarding process, so the CustomsLink Team and the wider business understand the processes, SLA‚Äôs and any KPI‚Äôs. We also need to: [REDACTED NAME] potential of reciprocal business envisaged.

¬†

 2. Current Lead List/Pipeline

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Explained current pipeline, explained warm, active, inactive and cold lists.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Talk further about active, what have the volumes been so far from: [REDACTED NAME] active customers.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì So far only HT Ferry have traded with declarations and 1 transit, way short of the anticipated volumes.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Explained none of the others have traded yet.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì I‚Äôll be honest here [REDACTED NAME] this pipeline isn‚Äôt great, and we need to: [REDACTED NAME] even on the warm list if you take away [REDACTED NAME] there isn‚Äôt much on there.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Explained that it isn‚Äôt fantastic, and it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] improvement with the amount in this pipeline.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Lets have a look at the call reports which I receive for everybody, if you look at this you don‚Äôt speak to: [REDACTED NAME] with many potential customers.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Agreed I haven‚Äôt made as many calls as I should have, and I will make more calls going forward.

¬†

Action ‚Äì A real focus on sales activity with a concentration on phone calls and face to: [REDACTED NAME]. Most of the activity is email based now and whilst this can be an effective form of new business development to gain a better understanding of requirement and build a better relationship direct contact: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Current targets ‚Äì to deliver 650 declarations per month - [REDACTED AMOUNT] bonus paid annually.

¬†

In addition, for every 1000 extra declarations achieved over 7800 decs per annum [REDACTED NAME] to receive [REDACTED AMOUNT] additional bonus (based on [REDACTED AMOUNT] selling price declaration - for larger customers we will work on the profit per dec to: [REDACTED NAME] bonus per 1000 declarations).

¬†

¬†

 3. S&S GB Progress

¬†

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Any progress so far on S&SGB?

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Still early days as initial call was only last week but roughly around 300 hauliers have been identified.

¬†

Action ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] current work agreed in the SSGB Review with a meeting to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2 weeks. If [REDACTED NAME] requires any support to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] deadlines are met.

¬†

¬†

 4. Training & Support Requirements

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì If there is anything we can do to: [REDACTED NAME], please speak up we are here to help.

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì No direct support currently needed apart from: [REDACTED NAME] reviews ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] offered internal assistance(see below).

¬†

¬†

 5. End of Probation

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì We are coming up to: [REDACTED NAME] of your probationary period and whilst the pipeline isn‚Äôt great we will pass your probationary period but this pipeline has to: [REDACTED NAME] the coming months. We absolutely believe you are the right person to: [REDACTED NAME]. If there is anything else we can do to: [REDACTED NAME] please speak up.

[REDACTED NAME] -¬† Agree to: [REDACTED NAME] these areas and will discuss with JG and the UK FL Sales Team to: [REDACTED NAME] communication.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Ok will do that would help.

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì Any further comments from: [REDACTED NAME]?

¬†

[REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì I completely echo what [REDACTED NAME] has said, I enjoy working with you but improvements must be made going forward to: [REDACTED NAME] increase in the pipeline.

So ‚Äì as you know we have hundreds of development request in the pipeline. Each one MUST stack up against each other and deliver a ‚ÄúVALUE‚Äù and we compare that against all the developments within the business.

¬†

You as HOT of that team, will write the business case for these ‚Äì eg What is saving or what is the commercial opportunity.

Example - ¬†I have a live example of a request I have rejected ‚Äì Someone within your team wanted an update doing on Trade vehicles so that when they were being sold, the vehicle was marked as loaded. I have done a quick calculation, and that development would assist us in less than .5% of all bookings. The actual dev would take 3-4 days. We don‚Äôt have 3-4 days for a dev that will impact 1 booking in 200 ‚Äì we have to: [REDACTED NAME] manually somehow. The developments we MUST focus on are the ones to: [REDACTED NAME] team blockers, and that‚Äôs what I will focus on.

This is YOUR team, managing YOUR pipeline in terms of priority. I am here to: [REDACTED NAME] process.

I don‚Äôt want this appear to: [REDACTED NAME], you team need to: [REDACTED NAME] do anything and everything to help‚Ä¶.but you guys must help yourselves in terms of organising the priority. So from: [REDACTED NAME] below ‚Äì what are your TOP 3 in terms of delivering the highest value, and why ?

¬†

Please let me absolutely assure you we are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] Contract Logistics Sector of our business work and will continue to: [REDACTED NAME] time and money to: [REDACTED NAME] results outlined in a robust strategic plan. We are committed to: [REDACTED NAME] and the Team, but it needs to: [REDACTED NAME] with a plan for success that both outlines the strategic platform and the projected ROI!

¬†

[REDACTED NAME].

¬†

From: John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>
Sent: 29 July 2025 10:17
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: I I was sat where you are - Contract Logistics

¬†

Id asks the following questions, and this is without prejudice or emotion, purely business perspective.

Contract logistics overheads including myself have been mentioned a few time

¬†

1 ‚Äì Are we serious about a contract logistics department, Yes or No

 * We already have a department working on this, however its dressed up, GL, DHL, Mardix, why have another?
 * Departments compete for budget, leadership attention, or strategic priority, leading to: [REDACTED NAME] inefficiency.
 * Forwarding focuses on speed and cost-efficiency in transport, while logistics may prioritise inventory control and service levels‚Äîthese goals can clash
 * Clients may be confused about the company‚Äôs core competency if messaging isn‚Äôt clear and unified ‚Äì IE Reload is Marketed actively, Contract logistics isn‚Äôt.
 * Coordinating two distinct operational models requires strong leadership and clear governance to: [REDACTED NAME] and misalignment
 * Investment decisions (e.g., in tech or infrastructure) may favour one department over the other, causing friction
 * If both departments target similar clients, there‚Äôs a risk of internal competition for the same business

¬†

2 ‚Äì If the answer is yes

 * How do we move forward
 * If I am to: [REDACTED NAME] this, I would need the bandwidth, ¬†autonomy and resource to do, I can‚Äôt win business and not be able to deliver.
    * DHL prime example ‚Äì I was on leave we got one quote, and only one quote then decided we wasn‚Äôt doing it. Easy way forward, there simply wasn‚Äôt any effort.

 * We need a team that will deliver.
 * I need to: [REDACTED NAME] from: [REDACTED NAME] SMT and any other duties.
 * We need to: [REDACTED NAME] design tools similar to: [REDACTED NAME] ‚Äì we don‚Äôt do this whatsoever or at least on a competitive scale.
 * This will take time and if the above isn‚Äôt in place it simply cannot be done.
 * Costs will be a major contributor, and without partners or resource we will simply fail. ¬†
 * We need accreditations - why would someone trust us with freight if we are not accredited -
 * We keep the own vehicles going different supplier and trial for two more months.
 * We need partners and suppliers to: [REDACTED NAME] and have the workload to: [REDACTED NAME] the arm we need whilst taking commercial risks and understanding commerciality, not job by job analysis. ¬†

¬†

3 If the answer is no

 * We salvage what business we have and want to: [REDACTED NAME] transfer or give notice
 * We commence processing now the human aspects

¬†

This is unfortunately the reality of how logistics work, with very fine margins, high work levels and little reward, a lot of business is won on costs alone, and is a good fit for primary work already in place.

¬†

¬†

Good morning [REDACTED NAME],

Apologies for the delay in responding‚ÄîI was awaiting further advice.

We will address each of the three matters separately rather than combining them into a single email.

Non-Compete Agreement

Regarding the non-compete agreement received, I am unable to: [REDACTED NAME] in its current form. The draft I briefly reviewed last Thursday included a defined time frame, whereas the version provided does not, and it also contains additional clauses that I did not propose or agree to.

As I am voluntarily entering into this agreement, I request the following amendments:

 * Removal of Sections 1, 2, and 3, as I did not agree to: [REDACTED NAME]. I remain aware of my existing contractual obligations, and this non-compete should serve only as an addition to: [REDACTED NAME] agreement.
 * Explicit statement that I am receiving no remuneration and that this agreement is voluntary.
 * A defined time limit, ending on 30 March 2026.
 * Clarification that I am signing to: [REDACTED NAME] and my daughter, [REDACTED NAME], ensuring normal working practices can continue and avoiding any conflict of interest.
 * Competitor companies must be specifically listed and limited to: [REDACTED NAME]. The current wording ‚Äúnot limited to‚Äù is too open to interpretation.
 * The agreement should become void upon Katie‚Äôs termination of employment, however that may occur during the stated period.
 * The scope must be restricted to: [REDACTED NAME] the Ferry, Rail, and Tunnel sectors of the business. Extending it to: [REDACTED NAME] operations leaves room for misinterpretation, particularly regarding freight forwarding or haulage companies.

I will forward a copy of the email I previously sent for reference.

DSAR

Once the above is resolved, I will advise on next steps. However, I reserve the right to exercise a DSAR in the future and will not sign any document that limits this right.

[REDACTED NAME]

At present, legal action remains only a potential consideration. A DSAR may be required to: [REDACTED NAME] further. I will not sign any document that prevents me from: [REDACTED NAME] action in the future, and I reserve all rights in this regard.

I hope we can resolve these matters promptly.

Im aware we are losing time as my employment terminates in 15 Days.¬†

Kind regards, [REDACTED NAME] Outlook for Mac

That said, I confirm that the amended agreement you have now provided is broadly acceptable, subject to: [REDACTED NAME] changes for your review.

¬†

Post termination clauses

Many thanks, [REDACTED NAME] your time today during the brief business standup. Whilst we are still finalising the final figures, we are quietly confident we hit budget again last month. If confirmed this will be a fantastic result for the business‚Ä¶well done everyone ! SALES There is work to: [REDACTED NAME] in some of our ferry markets that were slightly short of budgets, but we are within touching distance. That final effort from: [REDACTED NAME] customer service to: [REDACTED NAME] bookings will make difference...so well done and keep up the hard work. CUSTOMER SERVICE After the success of CustomsLink offshore team, we have planned to: [REDACTED NAME] team further with 3 new team members to: [REDACTED NAME] amazing work that the Customer Service team deliver. This new team will focus on ENS and portpasses in preparation for ICS and ELO. We are now live with the new Sales / Customer service / CustomsLink dial function. This will improve the user experience for our clients, so they can contact sales, customer service and CustomsLink directly from: [REDACTED NAME] board. RELOAD After a successful Q1 and Q2, there is work to: [REDACTED NAME] with Reload, which [REDACTED NAME] and the team are looking to deliver. The results will come guys, keep going. CONTRACT LOGISTICS John and Contract Logistics are working hard to: [REDACTED NAME] ways of working with the dedicated vehicles. The existing forwarding volumes remain strong, with preparations for Q4 underway. MARKETING Marketing efforts continue to: [REDACTED NAME] results to: [REDACTED NAME] sales enquiries and bookings for both CustomsLink and Freightlink. The guys are hard at work looking at new ways to: [REDACTED NAME] clients better understand the complexities of ENS and portpasses and Customs. Standby for more news. Keep going guys‚Ä¶great work. DVELOPMENT The development team are laser focused on delivering ICS2 upgrades, and whilst ELO has been delayed, we want to: [REDACTED NAME] for the 1st Sept, even if this is a manual process unto French authorities confirm our API. Whilst this will provide added complexities for our clients, this gives us additional commercial opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] clients. The dev team are also delivering some further upgrades to the Appv2, and the customs customer user experience, SMS service and a new mapping product. In the next 2 weeks, [REDACTED NAME] will be providing a monthly update with software release dates. CUSTOMSLINK CustomsLink has had another great month above budget, and the busiest month for Princes foods, so well done to: [REDACTED NAME] team. As reported, our ISO9XXXX was successful, so a big well done to: [REDACTED NAME] were involved. In other good news, [REDACTED NAME] coming back will give the team a real shot in the arm to: [REDACTED NAME] the platform and support the wider operations team....welcome back Dan. OPERATIONS The operations teams are now back to: [REDACTED NAME] now [REDACTED NAME] is back, let‚Äôs all remember how large our data base is approx. XXXXXXX which is a herculean task to: [REDACTED NAME] top of this number of schedules and pricing for over 9000 clients! That‚Äôs more than many ferry companies. This relies upon all the teams helping them keep the data current, so please consider our agreed OLA‚Äôs. Thank you for your patience at times. ACCOUNTS The accounts team are seeing the benefits of [REDACTED NAME] back in credit control and [REDACTED NAME] as xxxxxx who has supercharged the teams processing power. Great to: [REDACTED NAME] accounts team finally building a new team, ready for our future growth. HR [REDACTED NAME] is currently enjoying a well-earned break, and will no doubt return with a tan a smile and the normal high standard of HR support for the whole business. Meanwhile [REDACTED NAME] is doing a sterling job of developing her own skills supporting [REDACTED NAME] and the wider HR function, whilst also having a foot planted in the operations team. OFFICE MOVE [REDACTED NAME] is heavily involved with helping [REDACTED NAME] and I deliver the office move. We have another week or so effort to: [REDACTED NAME] office move. [REDACTED NAME] will provide an update in her weekly bulletin. [REDACTED NAME] and I would like to: [REDACTED NAME] all for all your immense hard work. The office move sees Freightlink and CustomsLink open a brand-new chapter of opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] a team. PS there could also be some little surprises coming your way from [REDACTED NAME] & the business. That last phone call for sales, the last conformation to a customer, that last declaration successfully completed, all add up. If we all deliver that little extra push, it adds up a big leap forwards.

redactedMessages.subject: FW: Lost Bookings last week
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

John asked me was there a way to: [REDACTED NAME] these lost bookings ‚Äì short answer no, not without dev ‚Äì with dev off top of my head is, a serios of new ‚ÄúCancelled ‚Äì X reason‚Äù

¬†

EG

¬†

Cancelled ‚Äì operator no space

Cancelled ‚Äì operator no response

Cancelled ‚Äì booked another route

Etc etc etc

¬†

When speaking to John ‚Äì in summary he is investigating standby bookings what he has discovered is there is a high number of bookings are cancelled because we were unable to: [REDACTED NAME] booking reference from: [REDACTED NAME] operator. If you look at the attached below there are 20 examples and when I did a quick analysis there are 13 cancelled bookings be because we were inefficient in obtaining a booking confirmation - that translates to 65%.

¬†

If we then use that statistic against all cancelled bookings it's a big number we are dealing with.

¬†

I know that CS are working very hard at standbys but there actually is a financial argument to having a dedicated resource on this. [REDACTED NAME] is providing more data to: [REDACTED NAME] he will analyse this further. I am fully aware that the CS team are manning up and training, but as an idea ‚Äì could [REDACTED NAME] as an example to: [REDACTED NAME] but chase standby bookings to: [REDACTED NAME] improvements could be made ?

¬†

I know you are AL next week ‚Äì just trying to: [REDACTED NAME] off.

¬†

¬†

BR

Director

Hi John

¬†

Apologies for the delayed response on this, we have not forgotten, and this has been discussed within the digital team.

¬†

I have now created 3 projects in the project log that haven‚Äôt been signed off but under investigation:

¬†

 1. 3T Integration- Excel download from F2 > Tom is looking at the excel export you require from F2 this week. Once we have more details we can get this scheduled in for development.

You have already noted that this will save you 20mins ‚Äì 3 hours a day depending on volume. Can you define those figures a little more:

 a. What volumes you at now? Including revenue
 b. Where do you expect the volumes to: [REDACTED NAME] in 1 month/2 month/3months and 6 months?

¬†

Additionally, is there any updates required in F2 for the finance team?

¬†

 2. Reload for contract Logistics > The question for this is do we add a new area in F2 for this or keep in reload. Under investigation.
     a. How much change is actually required compared with Reload?
     b. Can you scope something up for us, happily sit with you on this, need more of an insight in what you require.
     c. From: [REDACTED NAME] you note the time saving benefit for yourself and [REDACTED NAME], will this impact the customers in anyway?

¬†

 3. 3T Integration via API > This is on HOLD until figures have increased to a level that Directors sign off. API‚Äôs do take time to: [REDACTED NAME] with the current pipeline for FL customer service this will be lower priority until we see those volumes pick up.

¬†

Please note I have little knowledge on the Reload part of F2 so this will be a good learning exercise for me.

¬†

Kind regards

redactedMessages.subject: Sales source etc
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, it‚Äôs a lot more complex than a simple ‚Äúsales source‚Äù. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.

¬†

The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales‚Ä¶.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.

¬†

I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a ¬†‚Äúhouse account‚Äù. Hence the reason converted by ‚ÄúX‚Äù 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. ¬†

¬†

Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc [REDACTED NAME] produced is also attached.

¬†

Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.

¬†

My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. It‚Äôs not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest that‚Äôs the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.

¬†

However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope that‚Äôs all helpful.

¬†

Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

Subject: Commercial role

Gents,

¬†

As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CV‚Äôs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] role‚Ä¶whilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as ‚ÄúX‚Äù learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. It‚Äôs a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !

¬†

I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs knowledge of ‚ÄúCUSTOMS‚Äù is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.

¬†

So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg‚Ä¶.it is not a finished product !

¬†

See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-

¬†

 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here ‚Äúoffice manager‚Äù so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill [REDACTED NAME] role with a relatively lower salaried project manager ¬£ 30k - ¬£ 35K ‚Äì see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan ‚Äì so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners ‚Äì I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR‚Ä¶2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I don‚Äôt have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2 ‚Äì the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K ‚Äì his old job was ¬£ 90k)
 h. WILD CARD ‚Äì is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through ‚Äì but smells like 70K ????

¬†

I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I don‚Äôt, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the Stena Line POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. ¬†

¬†

For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.

¬†

I really hope this helps in some way.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

redactedMessages.body:
BR

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

¬†

From: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Date: Tuesday, 18 February 2025 at 22:41
To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: Sales source etc

Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

As discussed in SMM attached is a breakdown of the Sales sources and other descriptions we use. As I indicated, it‚Äôs a lot more complex than a simple ‚Äúsales source‚Äù. The different data capture points have grown over many years to: [REDACTED NAME] different requirements. I have tried to: [REDACTED NAME] of these and provide a breakdown.

¬†

The single closest thing we have to a single source of truth is Sales source. This is driven from: [REDACTED NAME] up in web / app > F2F2 > Account open > Sales input into a new tab in F2F2 manually. If the sales guys used this properly, we genuinely have a better picture. There are some fail safes in here to: [REDACTED NAME] stop sales manipulating the inbound sales and saying they converted it. I found generally they took an inbound call or rang an existing web/app account and then claimed a conversion,. Yes its sales‚Ä¶.its farming not hunting. Appreciate we need both. I have been here many times with sales. When we scratch the surface, we discover some bending of the truths.

¬†

I always encouraged sales to: [REDACTED NAME] sales on an annual basis to deliver +20% costs. The year prior sales then became a ¬†‚Äúhouse account‚Äù. Hence the reason converted by ‚ÄúX‚Äù 2024 / 2025 etc so we could track individual performance in that year. ¬†

¬†

Not complaining, we have done this exercise last year when we tried to: [REDACTED NAME] to follow a process. The original doc [REDACTED NAME] produced is also attached.

¬†

Again, not complaining, this took me 1h 45m today to: [REDACTED NAME] get into the details and test the data. I hope this helps you get a better understanding. Ordinarily I know you would go to: [REDACTED NAME] this, but I said I would deliver.

¬†

My POV, I think we make do with what we have and use it as intended and tighten up the process, or we bend the existing structures for new uses as you and John see fit. NB doing the second will muddy historical reporting. It‚Äôs not impossible, but please be-aware of the limitations this path would deliver. The data capture is complex and ties into many threads. As you know later this year, we will be looking to integrate a CRM, I would suggest that‚Äôs the time to: [REDACTED NAME] change things.

¬†

However this might be a bit disappointing in terms of change, I hope that‚Äôs all helpful.

¬†

Happy to: [REDACTED NAME] when we both have time.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

redactedMessages.subject: Re: SLA/OLA
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],

¬†

Working late. Bravo.

¬†

I think this is a good starting point. Well done !!!!

¬†

No it didn‚Äôt come up‚Ä¶.it really should have done. I will raise this with [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Like the OLA angle ‚Äì makes sense. Perfect !

The basic structure is sound. Well done ‚Äì you are very good at these.

¬†

Each OLA needs to: [REDACTED NAME] specific.

¬†

Eg Item 1 ‚Äì ‚ÄúSales will do this, including this level of information, via this method of communication to Operations, and the desired output is that. Time frame to: [REDACTED NAME] X‚Äù

¬†

Imagine you are writing a set of instructions for a new starter ‚Äì it must be that level of detail.

¬†

I am not sure who has given you a steer on the ‚Äúitems‚Äù to: [REDACTED NAME] within the OLA. I think this need clearing up. I am guessing this will be [REDACTED NAME] and [REDACTED NAME] to finalise.

¬†

Unlike a policy, I would make sure that the HOT are the signatories on this rather than directors. Make them responsible. If you want directors sign off, I recommend that the director responsible for the teams this impact signs off. EG In this instance, [REDACTED NAME] and I. We need visibility and understanding.

¬†

I don‚Äôt want to: [REDACTED NAME] be negative, but [REDACTED NAME] will not be dealing with any items like this until mid-April unfortunately. Perhaps when you discuss with [REDACTED NAME] ? redactedMessages.subject: Commercial role
redactedMessages.body:
Gents,

¬†

As times ticks on, I believe the role of commercial manager is becoming ever more critical to: [REDACTED NAME] in 2024+. As we go through the process and CV‚Äôs, the more I consider this conundrum. It becomes more and more apparent to: [REDACTED NAME] if we appoint the wrong person, [REDACTED NAME], closely followed by [REDACTED NAME], end up spending an increasing amount of time doing what you have both done for months which is backfilling [REDACTED NAME] role‚Ä¶whilst under increasing pressure. The role is that critical, failure means we really do apply pressure to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

If we do make a good appointment, there is the fact that we will lose 3+ months as ‚ÄúX‚Äù learns the ropes. Equally [REDACTED NAME], one of your strong feelings was always to: [REDACTED NAME] touch with sales. This position weakens that link, and in fact, the new owner of that team, we as directors become increasingly more reliant on them to: [REDACTED NAME] results for 2024. It‚Äôs a tough ask for someone with industry knowledge let alone a newbie !

¬†

I want to put a spotlight on the elephant. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs knowledge of ‚ÄúCUSTOMS‚Äù is very low (I am sure you will not mind me pointing this out). However, [REDACTED NAME] continues to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and the team to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. The no 1 problem we have in CL is SALES. [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs engagement here is low to medium. To: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME], we have witnessed [REDACTED NAME] ratcheting the rhetoric with CL strategy. I must assume this is not just a [REDACTED NAME] thought. Equally we all agree CL holds the BIGGEST opportunity of the 3 pillars. With this, we need to find a way to: [REDACTED NAME] best, [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] chances of success.

¬†

So how do we DE-RISK the sales, and IMPROVE % OF SUCCESS & PERFORMANCE ??? Lets not take anything from: [REDACTED NAME], and I accept this is not an exact round peg in a round hole, but I think this rounds a square peg‚Ä¶.it is not a finished product !

¬†

See Organogram PAGE 2

Attached Headlines:-

¬†

 a. Help [REDACTED NAME] with a heavy weight ‚Äì [REDACTED NAME] takes over managing CS and supports that unit. I have called here ‚Äúoffice manager‚Äù so she can carry on with some of the tasks she manages now.
 b. Back fill Jens role with a relatively lower salaried project manager ¬£ 30k - ¬£ 35K ‚Äì see (e)
 c. Decrease [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs direct management reports to focus. In Q1, [REDACTED NAME] report to John (think that was the plan ‚Äì so nothing new then)
 d. [REDACTED NAME] takes over Freightlink / CustomsLink sales inc partners ‚Äì I think I have said this before, put the best, [REDACTED NAME] the best, [REDACTED NAME]. He has done this job prior to a very high standard, so this massively de-risks the business position. Yes the learning curve remains with CL sales, BUT [REDACTED NAME] is a accomplished sales professional.
 e. LUMPY BIT 1)[REDACTED NAME] takes back strategic responsibility of CustomsLink..OR‚Ä¶2)we have to: [REDACTED NAME] unicorn to: [REDACTED NAME] business forward. If (2) delivers better performance, at this stage we cancel (b) above, [REDACTED NAME] will pick this up, and the digital has to manage. I think this is viable NOW, but when I am removed, it probably needs that skill.
 f. I don‚Äôt have a finalised vision of e2 (new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward.
 g. E2 ‚Äì the new role to: [REDACTED NAME] forward, I am not 100% convinced [REDACTED NAME] could deliver this. He is good guy, I am not convinced [REDACTED NAME] is that and I think he is C 70K ‚Äì his old job was ¬£ 90k)
 h. WILD CARD ‚Äì is there a better solution WITH John within the business ? I have run out of time to: [REDACTED NAME] one through ‚Äì but smells like 70K ????

¬†

I know in the past [REDACTED NAME] you have been uneasy with structure changes. I will be honest I don‚Äôt, If a team is not working as well as it could, change it in my view. I feel [REDACTED NAME] you worry about the Stena Line POV. My thoughts are IF any of the above sticks, we say nothing at the board meeting next week. When we visit in March, we tell them what we did to: [REDACTED NAME]. That shows good leadership. ¬†

¬†

For our internal team, these are all comfortable changes with no sudden jolts that would concern me when speaking to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Gents 100% I am not being mischievous here. I want what is best, [REDACTED NAME] business, and I know my opinions are challenging for your both. I am sorry for that, but in equal measure I need to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME] and thoughts.

¬†

I really hope this helps in some way.

¬†

Best, [REDACTED NAME] [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

Director

[REDACTED NAME]

[REDACTED EMAIL]

+44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]



[REDACTED ADDRESS]

redactedMessages.body:
I have done some digging here. I don't think we are bound to: [REDACTED NAME] off the documents requested:- IN RED


I DSAR request is personal data - obv this included emails etc TO: [REDACTED NAME] we have asked him to: [REDACTED NAME] something.

¬†

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† My complete employee file.

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Performance: All records relating to: [REDACTED NAME]. This includes performance reviews, all one-to-one meeting records (121s), including dates of submission, performance improvement plans, disciplinary records, and any other documentation relating to: [REDACTED NAME] performance.¬†

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Support and Guidance: All documents that have been used to: [REDACTED NAME] support my work and development. This includes training materials, policy documents, emails providing guidance and procedural explanations/guidelines, and any other relevant materials.

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† All communications, documentation, and correspondence: This includes all emails, text messages, instant messages, and any other form of electronic or written communication concerning me and my work whether they reference me directly or indirectly.

¬†

In accordance with GDPR, I request:

¬†

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† That this information is provided in a clear and easily understandable format within the statutory timeframe.

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Details of any recipients or categories of recipients to: [REDACTED NAME] data has been disclosed.

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Information on the purposes for which my data is being processed.

‚Ä¢¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† The envisaged retention period for my data, or the criteria used to: [REDACTED NAME] period.

¬†

Please confirm receipt of this request and kindly let me know at the earliest opportunity if you require any further details to: [REDACTED NAME] data.

¬†

Thank you for your cooperation.

¬†

Sincerely, ¬†

John Gaskell

¬†

redactedMessages.subject: Reload 2026 & personal terms - Confidential
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],
Thank you again for your time yesterday.
As discussed, due to a combination of factors, our volumes and gross profit will fall short of the 2025 budget. This unfortunately means we‚Äôre not in a position to: [REDACTED NAME] packages or costs at this time. The business is reliant on achieving its budget targets.
We shared our 2026 budget plans with you, which I trust you agree are realistic and take into account the challenges your team has faced this year. The budget reflects the current run rate with a 10% uplift, and you‚Äôll also benefit from: [REDACTED NAME] work from: [REDACTED NAME] following John‚Äôs departure.
Your continued commitment and support in delivering this plan is essential. You've made it clear that you do not wish to: [REDACTED NAME] hiring a new BDM at this stage, and we respect that decision. You know your clients and market better than anyone, and we support your approach. However, it‚Äôs vital that we see a clear recovery plan that drives growth.
I was encouraged to: [REDACTED NAME] you and your team will take ownership of generating new sales. As you know, we‚Äôve struggled to: [REDACTED NAME] this front in recent years, and we must avoid repeating that pattern in 2026.
To: [REDACTED NAME], we need to: [REDACTED NAME] a set of key KPIs that you and the team are fully aligned with. If we fall short of these KPIs, we must be prepared to: [REDACTED NAME] strategy. We cannot afford to: [REDACTED NAME] a plan that isn‚Äôt delivering results. If something isn‚Äôt working, we need to: [REDACTED NAME]‚Äîquickly and decisively.¬†
These KPIs will primarily focus on new business development and sales growth. Let‚Äôs work together to: [REDACTED NAME] have a robust framework in place to: [REDACTED NAME] drive performance.¬†
In recognition of your support and the extra hard work you will undertake in 2026, we will adjust your package as follows:-


 * Current salary [REDACTED AMOUNT] plus bonus
 * Monthly bonus 2025 (amended immediately) on target [REDACTED AMOUNT] per month (as discussed [REDACTED NAME] will agree these with you)
 * 01st Jan 2026 [REDACTED AMOUNT] (10.5% / [REDACTED AMOUNT])



For 2026, we will also amend your monthly targets as follows. This provides you with an easier initial target to hit (on budget), plus the ability to: [REDACTED NAME] more bonus as your overachieve.

To: [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, John Gaskell <john@freightlink.co.uk>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>, [REDACTED NAME] <[REDACTED EMAIL]>
Subject: New Performance Process & PIP

Hi [REDACTED NAME]

¬†

I hope you're well.

¬†

As part of our commitment to maintaining a consistent and supportive approach to: [REDACTED NAME] across the business, we are introducing a revised performance process that includes both informal and formal stages, along with a new¬†Performance Improvement Plan (PIP)¬†template, both attached to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

As mentioned in my presentation back in June at the Away Day, it‚Äôs really important that¬†all stages of the process are followed carefully and documented in writing. This ensures we are fair and consistent in our approach, and that any performance concerns are addressed as early and effectively as possible.

¬†

Key Points:

¬†

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Informal Stage: This is the first step where concerns are raised and discussed constructively with the employee. It‚Äôs an opportunity to: [REDACTED NAME] and set clear expectations, and ideally, nip any issues in the bud. This stage is carried out by you, as the line manager, but I‚Äôm always here to: [REDACTED NAME] support where needed.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Formal Stage: If performance does not improve following the informal stage, the formal process should be initiated, using the PIP to: [REDACTED NAME] objectives, timelines and support measures.

¬†

If you If you have any questions or need support in implementing the process, please don‚Äôt hesitate to: [REDACTED NAME].

¬†

Thank you for your attention to this.

¬†

[REDACTED NAME]

redactedMessages.subject: Proposed structure Freightlink / CustomsLink
redactedMessages.body:
Hi [REDACTED NAME],


Having had a few hours to: [REDACTED NAME] changes with Alex departing, this news presents immediate risks, but opportunities to deliver a considerable step up in our growth deliverables.


I have therefore quickly produced a proposal for structural changes which provides the best, [REDACTED NAME] success. Let's schedule in a call to discuss. Happy to have a conversation today and discuss in detail next Tue when back in work.


I hope this meets with your approval.


-----


Proposed Strategy 2025-2027
Key Focus: Profitability and Stability


Context:
With the departure of [REDACTED NAME] (AM) at the end of April, Freightlink (FL) and CustomsLink (CL) must pivot strategy to: [REDACTED NAME] immediate impact and position the for long-term growth and stability. While the previous plan involved supporting AM in delivering major projects, [REDACTED NAME] (MS), will lead the transition, committing to: [REDACTED NAME] for the next five years to establish a robust structure that drives growth opportunities and ownership.


---


Business Overview:


[REDACTED NAME] ¬†
- Relationship-driven and technology-focused business. ¬†
- Relationships with ferry suppliers are critical to operations, supported by SaaS tools. ¬†
- Freight ferry industry has limited key decision-makers meaning reputation is critical
- c.15 reputable freight ferry agencies across Europe.
- Freightlink ranks third in size v competition with an UK / EU market freight ferry market share of <0.5%.


CustomsLink ¬†
- Knowledge intensive business specializing in customs procedures presented via a SaaS platform. ¬†
- Software domain knowledge is mission-critical for operations. ¬†
- GB declaration market penetration of <0.01%.


Key Success Factors:
- Strong relationships with ferry operators. ¬†
- Domain expertise in customs knowledge and software.


---


Challenges:


[REDACTED NAME] ¬†
- AM‚Äôs departure will destabilize operations for 3-6 months. ¬†
- Staff, especially [REDACTED NAME] (low flight risk), will require reassurance and support during this period. ¬†


[REDACTED NAME] ¬†
- Ferry operators will react with scepticism and speculate about potential company sale or increased Stena Line control. Competitors are likely to: [REDACTED NAME] to: [REDACTED NAME]‚Äôs market reputation. ¬†
- MS [REDACTED NAME] maintain direct, proactive engagement with ferry operators during the first 12 months to: [REDACTED NAME] concerns and reinforce trust.


---


Strategic Plan:


2025 (April - December):
- MS [REDACTED NAME] MD position; [REDACTED NAME] (JM) continues as Assistant MD. ¬†
- MS [REDACTED NAME] JM split responsibilities, leveraging their strengths to: [REDACTED NAME]. ¬†
- Initiate senior recruitment for CustomsLink. ¬†
- MS [REDACTED NAME] on key staff development, particularly [REDACTED NAME], [REDACTED NAME], John, [REDACTED NAME], [REDACTED NAME], [REDACTED NAME], and the new Head of IT. ¬†
- Controlled response in the market with MS [REDACTED NAME] relationships with ferry operators.


2026:
- Recruit an Operations Director in Q2-Q3, with [REDACTED NAME] as a potential candidate. ¬†
- MS [REDACTED NAME] JM accelerate the development of the Operations Director, ensuring alignment with strategic goals.


2027:
- Transition Operations Director to: [REDACTED NAME]. ¬†
- MS [REDACTED NAME] deliver project work 28+


---


Advantages:
1. Team Cohesion:
MS [REDACTED NAME] full support to: [REDACTED NAME] business and drive growth plans. Distractions are minimized to: [REDACTED NAME] and MS [REDACTED NAME] focus on strategic execution. ¬†
2. Controlled Succession Plan: Smooth transition without knee-jerk recruitments. Succession planning aligns with growth milestones. ¬†
3. Market Confidence:
Proactive engagement with ferry operators prevents reputational risks and reinforces relationships. ¬†
4. Long-Term Commitment:
MS [REDACTED NAME] through to 2030 ensures sustained progress and stability.


---


Disadvantages:
- Delayed recruitment of a permanent MD.


---


Key 2025 Milestones:
- Office relocation. ¬†
- Netherlands broker partnership established. ¬†
- Mediterranean sales micro-office operational. ¬†
- New Head of IT onboarded. ¬†
- Phase 1 of F3 (back end operational system) automation/AI implemented.¬†
- CustomsLink budget targets achieved. ¬†
- Senior Management Team (SMT) development plan activated. ¬†
- Realignment of MBO targets for JM and MS.


---


This refined proposal maintains a clear focus on stability, profitability, and structured succession planning while addressing key challenges and opportunities.¬†


Suggested statement: External release as discussed; my suggestion would be to: [REDACTED NAME] comment regarding the MD position. Internal MS [REDACTED NAME] take on the MD role. Only ferry operators will be interested. MS [REDACTED NAME] be in contact: [REDACTED NAME] week.


BR
[REDACTED NAME]
Director
M +44 (0) [REDACTED PHONE]
